Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: This is ridiculous.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Do you have any idea what time we'll get out of here?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nobody likes to work late, least of all me. [to Jim] Do you have plans tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope I don't, remember when you told us not to make plans 'cause we're working.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes I remember. Mmm, this is B.S. This is B.S. Why are we here? I am going to call corporate. Enough is enough, I'm - God, I'm so mad! [on phone] This is Michael Scott, Scranton, well we don't want to work. No we don't! It's not fair to these people. These people are my friends and I care about them! We're not going to do it! [hangs up] Everybody I just got off the horn with corporate and basically I told them where they could stick their little overtime assignment. Go enjoy your Friday.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, happy Friday. [to Jim] Well I think we dodged a bullet there.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think you did.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think we should celebrate. How about you, Pam, mi casa, a little dinner, dancing, drinks?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You said you didn't have plans. That's what you said.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael has asked Pam and me to dinner at least 9 times. And every time we've been able to get out of it. But I've got to give him credit, he got me. Because I'm starting to suspect that there was no assignment from corporate.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, what time should I be arriving?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, it's couples only. And besides, I only have six wine glasses, so it will be me and Jan, and Pam and Jim, and Angela and Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey-o!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Does it bother me that I wasn't invited to Michael's dinner party? [breaks down crying]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: How are you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on in. Good to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Chilly huh? So glad we finally got to do this with you guys. You wanna take their coats babe?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes I would. So, what have you been doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Let's see, since I saw you an hour ago?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I have been getting ready and then driving over here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well we have been doing pretty much the same thing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Except driving.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We got you this. [gives a bottle of wine]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh well Pam, thank you, this will be great to cook with.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well have a seat, or come on in, or, I don't know, make yourself to home. This is our casa.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's really nice.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: So what do you guys think, should we do the tour first or the appetizers first?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Tour, let's do the tour first.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Do you have a preference babe? Upstairs first?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Totally your call babe.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Alright, well, let's go then, I say upstairs.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, you guys doing a little construction?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, just redoing the sliding glass door.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yeah, so sorry about this God-awful carpet, we're still a work in progress here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, thats...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: This is my office.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yep, never been used.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Not super exciting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: And this is my workspace.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is it, check that out, can you smell that? [the room is filled with candles that say "Serenity by Jan"]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: As you can smell there's a lot of different odors going on in here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So you have an office and a workspace?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I do, I cannot create in the same space I conduct business, I'm sure that you're the same with your doodles. [puts a candle to Jim's nose] Smell.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's fire.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Uh-huh, Bonfire.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Bond.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Men love this one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: James Bond Fire. I am Bond fire, James Bond Fire. Michael Scarn. [clicks tongue]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: When I get frustrated, or irritated or... angry, I come up here and I just smell all my candles and it just -poof- goes away.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Just like that.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Just like that.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: So this is the master bedroom, and these walls used to like white, like an asylum. So I wanted it to be softer, So I had it painted in eggshell white.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Guess what, white and eggshell white are exactly the same color.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [puts away video camera facing the bed] Babe I thought you said you were going to tidy things up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I-

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Shame on you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What a cute bench.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks, that's my bed. Jan has some space issues, so I curl up on that puppy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really? 'cause... seems pretty narrow... and short.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's actually a lot bigger than it seems. Look at this. [Lies down]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: See, he fits perfectly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I finally broke down and bought myself a plasma TV. Check it out. [reveals a tiny TV] I actually hung this on the wall myself. I want to show you something . A lot of people in the room, need more space? [moves TV back a couple inches] Voila, right in the wall.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sometimes I will just stand here and watch television for hours. I love it, I love this TV. Oh and I also built this table.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What is that chestnut?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I think that is either pine, or nordic cherry.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: It's pine.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, I'm just terrible at all this stuff, so that's really cool.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, he tried to set up my TIVO for me but then I didn't have audio for a week.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If you ever need any help, I am just a phone call away.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I bet you are.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I saw - oh your Dundies. I'm surprised they're not out on the coffee table for everybody to see.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: It was between the neon beer sign and the Dundies so I said "Honey keep the trophies."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh honey, I have the best trophy right here, aside from my Dundies.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [doorbell] Oh, excuse us just a second.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'll get it.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [Andy and Angela enter] So glad you're finally able to be here.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [Michael tries to hug Angela] No, no.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Tuna! What's up Tuna, we having tuna for dinner? [to Pam] I bet you're sick of tuna right? You probably have tuna every night. Tuna! [to Jan] These are for you. [hands flowers]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, how thoughtful.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Very nice.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Except for one flower, which is for... my flower.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Aw.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What am I supposed to do with this?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: How 'bout we do the short tour and then I'll start dinner?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh I can help starting dinner if you need it.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh no no no, it's just the osso buco needs to braise for about three hours, everything else is done.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Three hours from now or three hours from earlier like 4:00?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You know Pam, in Spain they often don't start eating until midnight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When in Rome.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Do you have a preference, upstairs first?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whatever you say babe.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Follow me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How 'bout a toast. Shall I? Here's to good friends.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Cheers.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kinda sorta an oaky afterbirth.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What was that?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: So music, should we turn some music?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah that sounds good.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Do you guys remember my old assistant Hunter? He is an excellent songwriter.

Quote.Speaker: Hunter's CD
Quote.Text: You took me by the hand, Made me a man, That one night, You made everything all right, So raw, so right, All night, all right, Oh yeah, Oh yeah, So raw, so right, All night, all right, Oh yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what, Hunter was a terrible assistant, that is why Ryan fired him.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well I think he's probably just about as reliable as Pam being that it usually takes you an afternoon to get back to me.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Sometimes I think she holds on to faxes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [To camera] I don't care what they say, I just want to eat. Which I realize is a lot to ask for... at a dinner party.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [playing charades] No it's a... hump. There's a hump.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Joe Camel!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay yes, first name of that animal and the second name is the state where Helena is the capital.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Montana.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Joe Montana!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes! Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why didn't you just say 49ers quarterback?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, [rhythim clapping] my my my my turn, my my my my turn, my my my my turn.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Babe can you just like really, woah, could you just simmer down?

Quote.Speaker: Michae
Quote.Text: What, no, I'm just making people laugh.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, I was watching Jim's face.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I was watching Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And he was laughing.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No smiling.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look at him, he's laughing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael and Jan seem to be playing their own separate game and it's called 'Let's see how uncomfortable we can make our guests' and they're both winning. So I'm going to make a run for it. [holds cellphone]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You'll never guess, I just got a message from my landlord apparently, my apartment flooded, something with a sprinkler. Pam, we should probably get going and see the damage.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well you don't need two of you to do that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's true. Um... dinner sounded delicious. Pam I'll see you at home, thank you so much.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh Jim, I don't think you're going to abandon this party here all by itself.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know because I everything I own is there.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You can buy new stuff but you can't buy a new party.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's true, that's a great point. Come on down here. Sit down on that couch and be amongst friends and we are not going to think about all your stuff being destroyed, all right.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Michael, you're up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right here we go, this is going to be fun, ready. All right first name is Tom-

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No no no, no names, no names, no rhyming, no soundalikes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, Okay, okay, you're getting inside my head. First name is blank and he goes on a cruise, he goes on a Caribbean CRUISE.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Katie Holmes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, Baah! But he's married to her!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, Dawson's Creek.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No! It has to be a real person Jim, come on. Okay, no no, I'm gonna pass, I'm gonna pass. Okay, rhymes with Parnold Schporzenegger.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No rhyming!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not really a rhyme.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Another clue, another clue.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, he is the governor of California, he is the Terminator.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Those aren't helpful.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Tom Cruise!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Time!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: God, does anybody read the paper?!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Michael offers his coat to Pam, who is shivering] Oh, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [eyes Pam] I'm so, so sorry for the temperature in here. The um, sliding glass door shattered. It's actually a really cute story. Do you wanna tell it babe or should I tell it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't like that story babe.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Come on, it's a cute story, Michael ran through the sliding glass doors because he thought he heard the ice cream truck!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop, stop it! I mean, I like ice cream. Okay? Sue me. Oh, no, don't. I shouldn't say that jokingly because she will sue me. She loves to sue, loves lawsuits. You know honey, that door was extremely clean and it looked invisible.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You are so right, you're so right because before I lived here, the glass was always covered in smudges, and then I moved in and I cleaned it so I guess that makes me the Devil.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ha ha, you are! She is! She is the devil! I'm in hell! Aaahhh I'm burning, help me!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You shouldn't joke about that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is there more wine in the kitchen?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I will get it, I will get it, what kind of hostess would I be if I didn't get. It's okay, I don't mind. In fact you know what, girl's trip, Angela come on. Girl's trip.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [checking the oven] Uh, not even close.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: So you keep a very tidy house.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You should see our bathroom after Michael takes a bath, whew. But I don't have to tell you Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, yeah. What?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh well don't tell me that he's really changed since you guys dated.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, are you joking?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, Michael told me a little bit about it, but I see the way you look at him.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I have never, ever dated, or wanted to do anything resembling dating Michael, ever. Not ever, not now, not then, not now, not ever, ever.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I've noticed how you look at him at the office.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in the garage] So I spend most of my time right here. Have a hand [the chairs are shaped like hands]. So Jim I noticed you checking out Jan's candles.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh no she just put it in front of my face.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, did you know that candles are the number one fastest-growing product in the scent aroma market? $2 billion dollar a year industry. And for only $10,000, you could become a co-owner of "Serenity by Jan" What do you think about that?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thought about it, I'm in.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, are you really trying to get us to invest in Jan's company?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. [doorbell rings] What now?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Coming! [Dwight and a woman are at the door holding wine glasses and a cooler]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What are you doing here?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We came here to eat dinner and to party, this is a dinner party right?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [whispering] Awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What is he doing here?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes, What are you doing here?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight is my friend.

Quote.Speaker: Woman
Quote.Text: We weren't invited?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You said that I could not invite Dwight because he was not part of a couple, and because we didn't have enough wine glasses. Dwight brought glasses and a person.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Fine, whatever you want, just like always, whatever you want.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whatever I want? It's never whatever I want. When I wanted to see Stomp, and you wanted to see Wicked, what did we see?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: We saw Wicked.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When I said that I wanted to have kids, and you said, you wanted me to have a vasectomy, what did I do? And then when you said that you might want to have kids and I wasn't so sure, Who had the vasectomy reversed? And then when you said you defintely didn't want to have kids, who had it reversed back? Snip snap! Snip snap! Snip snap! I did. You have no idea the physical toll, that three vasectomies have on a person. And I bought this condo to fill with children.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I am so sorry that I don't want to bring kids into this screwed-up world, okay? But look if you want to have kids, then fine you win. Let's have a [bleep]ing kid.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you mean it? You want to have a kid? [Jan walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I hate my life.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So can we come in?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hmmm... Mmm... great turkey leg.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [crying] I'm just gonna check on dinner. [Jan gets up from the table]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Angela, would you like some of my beet salad?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I hate beet salad.

Quote.Speaker: Woman
Quote.Text: It's actually really good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey hey hey hey. [to Angela] I know you love beet salad. I've seen you eat it many times.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: The thought of popping one of your beets into my mouth makes me want to vomit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [leans across to Pam whispering] Pam... I hope she didn't do anything to the food.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [whispers] Like... like what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can't prove it but I think she might be trying to poison me. [Jan serves the food] Hey, looks great babe.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah it does.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know Jan didn't poison the food. I know that. But if she was going to poison the food of someone at that table wouldn't it be me? Michael's former lover?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [Michael dips his steak into his wine] Can you not do that? It's disgusting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know I have soft teeth, how can you say that?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oops.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Excuse me for a second. [gets up from the table]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to babysitter] So... how do you guys know each other?

Quote.Speaker: Woman
Quote.Text: I was his babysitter.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And now you guys are dating?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Purely carnal and that's all you need to know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Would you write down your e-mail because I have just so many questions...

Quote.Speaker: Woman
Quote.Text: E-mail?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nevermind.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok... alright... here we go. [takes down huge painting behind his seat and puts up a neon beer sign] There. [plugs it in] Oooookay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's nice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everybody enjoying their meal?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Hey babe?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: How about we take the beer sign down until our guests leave and then we can discuss it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No. I'm gonna leave it up. I think it ties the whole room together.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Ok. [gets up and goes over to the stereo and turns on Hunter's CD really loud]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to the guests] Jan thinks Hunter is very talented. You know what? I don't think he's that good.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: At least he's an artist.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: BFD. I'm a screenwriter.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [shouting] AND I'M A CANDLEMAKER BUT YOU DON'T HEAR ME BRAGGING ABOUT IT!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: NO ALL YOU DO IS YOU GET ME TO TRY TO WORK ON MY RICH FRIENDS!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: FOR AN INVESTMENT OPPORTUNITY!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: MAN! I WOULD LOVE TO BURN YOUR CANDLES!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: YOU BURN IT. YOU BUY IT!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OH GOOD. I'LL BE YOUR FIRST CUSTOMER!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: AND YOU'RE HARDLY MY FIRST!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [yells] THAT'S WHAT SHE SAID! [Jan gets an evil look on her face and picks up Michael's dundie and throws it into his plasma screen tv] THAT IS A 200 DOLLAR PLASMA SCREEN TV YOU JUST KILLED! Good luck paying me back on your zero dollars a year salary plus benefits, babe! [Jan goes upstairs crying.]

Quote.Speaker: Woman
Quote.Text: I'm gonna get going.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fine. Get outta here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's getting late.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what guys, she'll be out of the bathroom soon.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Jim and Pam head out the door and there are policemen at the door] Of course

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Get out of my way, I'll take care of this. OK.[to police] Uhhh what seems to be the problem officers?

Quote.Speaker: Officer 1
Quote.Text: Not now Dwight, We got a call about a disturbance?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nope. Nope. Nothing disturbing here. Just a couple of friends having an awesome dinner party.

Quote.Speaker: Officer 2
Quote.Text: The neighbors said they heard some shouting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh... yes. There was some screaming but... um... my girlfriend... threw a dundie at my TV. Plasma.

Quote.Speaker: Officer 1
Quote.Text: You wanna press charges?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Would she get into trouble?

Quote.Speaker: Officer
Quote.Text: Yes. She'd be charged.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will take the fall. I did it.

Quote.Speaker: Officer 2
Quote.Text: You know you don't have to press charges, you could just try to be more quiet.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [running out the door)] Michael! [pleading] Michael. What are you doing to him?

Quote.Speaker: Officer 1
Quote.Text: Sir, do you have any other place you can stay? Maybe with one of your friends here?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [puts his hand on the Officer's shoulder] Michael can come home with me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim? Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh... my apartment's on fire

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [whispers] Flooded.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Flooded.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You people. [to Michael] Come on. You're sleeping with me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm gonna take you home Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Alright. [leads Michael away]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Bye Babe!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Pam and Jim are sitting in Jim's car in front of Detroit Coney Island Chili Dogs] This is the best burger I've ever had, babe.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know, babe, I should have told you but... I did something bad.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [holds up Hunter's CD] I stole this. [Pam laughs] For you babe.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Hunter's voice starts singing, Pam joins in] One night...

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Cut to Michael holding his head out of Dwight's car]

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Cut to Andy and Angela in Andy's car eating Ice cream. Andy tries to steal a bite of Angela's. She rolls down the window and smashes it against his car]

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Jan is watching Michael's cracked plasma screen TV and tries to fix his Dundie.]

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Michael and Dwight slow at a red light and see the woman at the bus stop, she waves to Dwight, who passes her by.]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My ideals at a party? Easy. Jim. Pam. Ryan. The Mayor. Barack Obama. Shiloh Jolie-Pitt. Because at the end of the night, Brad or Angelina would have to come and pick him up and I would get to meet them. Shia La Beef because of Disturbia. Umm, all of the children of the world. Val Kilmer. But he probably wouldn't come, too famous. Obviously George Clooney. Umm... And Jan definitely, if there was room.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll tell you about my ideal dinner party. John Wilkes Booth. Lee Harvey Oswald. Osama Bin Laden. John Wayne Gacy. Jeffrey Lionel Dahmer. "Oh hey guys, welcome to my home. Oh, here comes the waiter with the soup, hope you guys are hungry." Meanwhile, the waiter suddenly nods at me. [Dwight nods] But I don't acknowledge him. But I know he's an assassin because I trained him. Boom. Two minutes later, five dead psychopaths at my dining room table. All that's left to do is dispose of the bodies and collect the reward. Ugh, it's almost too easy.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: A little amuse-bouche, anyone?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Jim, quietly] Food!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Okay, trivia! Does anyone know what that means?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I believe it means mouth pleaser.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's French. I studied some French during my semester at sea. Or, shall I say a semester at la mer, which is French for 'sea.'

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Andy, was that coordinated by the Cornell Study Abroad Office?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm, mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: The reason I ask is that Andy went to Cornell.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [Michael comes out of the powder room to rejoin the group] Ahh, did you wash your hands, babe?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, I did, for you, princess. Even though I only went number one. [quietly to Jim] I didn't really wash my hands. Ohhh, what have we here? This looks delicious. [picks up amuse-bouche tray]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [quietly] Not with your hands.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [touching and moving each amuse-bouche] They need to be presented... royally... anyone?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mmm. [takes one and eats it]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good stuff. All right. Let's get down to some wine drinking.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, my God, [eating a bar in the hallway] I thought I was gonna pass out. [Jim takes it from her and takes a bite]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We should probably get back.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmm-mm. I'm probably just gonna stay here for a while, say I got lost.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [coming up suddenly] Are you eating?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It was just a little...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I didn't have anything, Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Really, Pam. This is a dinner party. [walks away. Pam looks at Jim accusingly]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. She scares me. [walks away, Pam keeps eating]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael's dinner party is for couples only, which is why I wasn't initially invited. But that was then. I very recently entered into a serious, monogamous relationship. [looking around] If that idiot ever gets here.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: So, this girl that I basically grew up with becomes Miss West Virginia, and then suddenly, all the boys start paying attention to me. And it was funny because, you know, I never even considered myself beautiful until people started pointing it out to me. You know, "Jan, wow, you are so much more beautiful than Miss West Virginia." [laughs] Ah, so that is why I uh... wait, Pam, what was your, what was your question?"

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Where did you grow up?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's been a rough couple of weeks.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, I just got into a little trouble with the neighbors.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Little trouble. Yes. Well, Jan fell asleep during her neighborhood watch shift.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow, you did neighborhood watch?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I did, and I had a very late shift and I had a little bit of wine and I fell asleep.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So she's passed out, and some kids spray-paint a swear word on the neighbors' dog...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And the neighbors blamed Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yeah. But, you know, it was my fault.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's like, you know, the dog shouldn't have been outside in the first place. Anyway, it's a tragedy, really, because the paint is not gonna come off the dog until it sheds...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: It was me!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's that?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I spray-painted that dog. It was sleek, and shiny, and perfect little haircut, it was parading around like it was God's gift to this God-forsaken town [laughs] and I just couldn't take it anymore, so I went over there and I held down my knee and I just spray-painted it until I was good and done. [claps] It bit me on the arm, [reaches out and taps Jim] I didn't even feel it.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What are you doing to him? What... [sees neighbors' dog] is this about that stupid, ugly mutt?

Quote.Speaker: Neighbor
Quote.Text: She's a Weimaraner, you bitch!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Please, please. Don't hurt him, okay?
